title: Sri Varaha Dwadashi | Appearance day of Lord Varahadeva | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 13-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjani Shalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Ganadhara Srivasa Adi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Today is the most auspicious appearance day of Lord Varahadeva
A very extraordinary incarnation of the Lord in the form of a transcendental boar incarnation
A very extraordinary incarnation of the Lord in the form of a transcendental boar incarnation
I will be reciting a verse from the Bhagavatam
Bhagavatam contains a nice description of Lord Varahadeva's appearance and pastimes
The first canto third chapter entitled Krishna is the source of all incarnations
In this chapter there is a description of the Varaha incarnation in the seventh verse
The meaning of this verse is
The supreme enjoyer of all sacrifices
Accepted the incarnation of a boar
And for the welfare of the earth
He lifted the earth from the nether regions of the universe
So in the parpot Srila Prabhupada explains regarding this appearance of the lord as a boar
The indication is that for each and every incarnation of the personality of Godhead
The particular function executed is also mentioned
So this verse says why did the lord appear as Varaha
To lift the earth from the lower regions of the universe
There cannot be any incarnation of the lord to lift the earth from the lower regions of the universe
There cannot be any incarnation without a particular function. Every incarnation has got a very specific function and such functions are always extraordinary.
Lifting the entire earth planet out of the depths of the Garbhodaka ocean simply by lifting it on the snout.

You can imagine how big the Varaha form of the Lord would have been simply to support the earth between the two tusks on the snout and lift it effortlessly as a Leela and place it back perfectly in the orbit.
That is what the Lord did.
Extraordinary activities are impossible for any living being to perform.
That nobody else can do it. No yogi, no jnani, no karmi, no devata, no asura. Nobody can do it.
The incarnation of the Bohr was to take the earth out of Pluto's region of filthy matter.
the earth was to be lifted up.
Picking up something from a filthy place is done by a Bohr.
And the all-powerful personality of Godhead displayed this wonder to the asuras who had hidden the earth in such a filthy place.
Particularly the asura by name Hiranyaksha.
He had hidden the earth in the filthy place.
And the earth is the place of residence for the human beings and many other varieties of living entities.
But at the beginning of this Manvantara, when the earth was to be populated,
then the earth itself was in the bottom of the Garbhodaka ocean, Garbha ocean.
So to pick it up was required because the earth is the place of residence for so many living beings in different life forms.
There is nothing impossible for the personality of Godhead.
And although he played the part of a Bohr, by the devotees he is worshipped.
But the Lord, when he appears in this particular form,
he is always worshipable in all forms because all forms are transcendental.
We should never think that this form of the Lord as Bohr is similar to the Bohr form in this material world.
The form of the Lord is always transcendental.
So devotees worship the Lord even in the form of Bohr.
And the Lord is always staying in transcendence.
He always remains in the spiritual platform.
He never becomes affected by the material nature.
He never is influenced by material nature.
On the other hand, he is always the controller of material nature.
And he remains the Supreme Lord under all circumstances, eternally, always, in any form he may appear.
Just for the sake of his Leela, he assumes different forms.
Then, in one more place, in the second canto, seventh chapter,
the first words are spoken by Brahma.
tam damstraya adhrim iva vajradharo dadhara
The meaning of this verse is, Lord Brahma is speaking,
when the unlimitedly powerful Lord assumed the form of a Bohr as a pastime,
just to lift the planet Earth, which was drowned in the great ocean of the universe called the Garbhodaka.
and the Lord pierced him with his tusk.
This Hiranyaksha had hidden the Earth in the bottom of the Garbhodaka ocean.
So the Lord came to lift this Earth.
And when Hiranyaksha prevented the Lord from rescuing the Earth,
then there was a fight between the Lord, Lord Varaha and Hiranyaksha.
And Hiranyaksha was delivered simply by the Lord piercing with his tusk,
So in the purport to this verse,
Srila Prabhupada says, since the beginning of creation,
the demons and demigods or the Vaishnavas are always two classes of living beings
to dominate the planets of the universe.
So among the Devatas, Lord Brahma is the first Devata.
And among the demons in this universe,
Hiranyaksha is the first demon in this universe.
The first Devata and the first Asura.
Only under certain conditions do the planets float as weightless balls in the air.
They float in the air only under specific conditions.
And as soon as these conditions are disturbed,
the planets may fall down in the Garbhodaka ocean,
The universe is like a huge shell.
And half the shell is covered by water called Garbhodaka ocean.
That is what is explained here.
The other half is a spherical dome.
Within which the innumerable planetary systems exist.
The floating of the planets in the weightless air
is due to the inner constitution of the globes.
And the modernized drilling of the earth to exploit oil from within
is a sort of disturbance by the modern demons.
So much oil exploration is going on.
So much oil is being taken out of the earth.
But then it does disturb the conditions under which the earth is floating in the atmosphere.
So this disturbance by modern demons
can result in a greatly harmful reaction to the floating condition of the earth.
So it is not humanly possible.
Neither it is possible by any Devata or anybody else other than the Supreme Lord
to maintain this balance of the earth remaining in the atmosphere above the Garbhodaka ocean.
And the earth also moving in its orbit perfectly.
That is facilitated by the Lord.
A similar disturbance created formerly by the demons headed by Hiranyaksha.
Hiranyaksha is described to be the great exploiter of the gold rush.
It means he was, Hiranya means gold.
So he was interested in gold.
Why? Because Asuras want to enjoy unlimitedly, sense gratification.
And they require huge amounts of money for that.
Therefore this Hiranyaksha was always after gold.
And therefore he is called Hiranyaksha,
the exploiter of the gold rush.
And the earth was detached from its weightless condition
and fell down into the Garbhodaka ocean
due to the mischief of this Asura, Hiranyaksha.
The Lord as maintainer of the whole creation of the material world
therefore assumed the gigantic form of a boar
and picked up the earth from the water of the Garbhodaka.
The Lord went inside the water
and picked up the earth from the bottom of the Garbhodaka ocean.
Sri Jayadev Goswami, the great Vaishnava poet, has sung as follows.
Jayadev Goswami has written a song called Dasavatara Stotra.
In that Dasavatara Stotra, the third verse describes the incarnation of the Lord as Varaha.
Kesava drita shukara roopa jaya jagadishahare
This is the third verse sung by Jayadev Goswami in glorification of Supreme Lord.
who assumed the form of a boar,
O Lord, the planet earth rested on your tusks
and it appeared like the moon engraved with spots.
When the Lord lifted the earth,
the earth was resting on his tusks,
then the Lord appeared very very beautiful.
Such is the symptom of an incarnation of the Lord.
The incarnation of the Lord is not the concocted idea of fanciful men
who create an incarnation out of imagination.
The incarnation of the Lord appears under certain extraordinary circumstances.
when there was a need for the Lord to
Then the Lord appears as Varaha
and he kills this demon Hiranyaksha.
by the tiny brain of mankind.
but it is beyond our comprehension
how the Lord can appear in the form of a boar or Varaha.
How he can perform so many pious activities.
what all the kind of activities he performs.
There is no exertion on his part.
The modern creators of the many cheap incarnations
may take note of the factual
incarnation of God as a gigantic boar.
Varaha is the specific form of the Lord
in order to bless the people of this world.
Now it is also described here
when the Lord appeared to pick up the earth
the demon of the name Hiranyakya
he was killed by being pierced by
Now in the Bhagavatam third canto
into the depths of the ocean.
to the depths of the ocean.
it is best to let the
Krishna is seated in our heart.
to bewilder the asuras devotees understand and they know the lord appear can appear in any form
required for his pastime he comes to rescue the devotees he comes to annihilate the demons and he
comes to re-establish religious principles paritranaya sadhunam inasha
ayachadushkotam dharmasamsthapanarthaya sambhavami yuge yuge so in the bhagavad
gita this is explained so the lord appeared in this boar form just to actually
protect the devotees who are always harassed by demons
so the lord went diving into the giant mountain sorry into the water of the garba ocean and the
became as if divided into two high waves and the ocean was praying to the lord
oh lord of all sacrifices please do not cut me into two kindly protect me so the ocean was very
afraid of the gigantic boar going diving inside the garba ocean so the lord as the varaha form
have penetrated the water with his hooves which are like sharp arrows
and found the limits of the ocean although it was unlimited this ocean is garbotion is very very very
very huge but still the lord went down and found the bottom and he saw the earth resting place of
all living entities lying as it was in the beginning of creation and he personally lifted it
very easily he did that by placing the earth on his tusks and got it out of water
now when he was coming out of the water because this hiranyaksha had hidden the
earth in the bottom of the universe hiranyaksha tried to stop the lord
then there was a fight between the supreme lord in his boar incarnation and hiranyaksha so the lord
killed hiranyaksha by piercing that demon's body with his tusk
and in this way hiranyaksha was killed and the earth was placed in its proper orbit
so then the sages with great respect they offered wonderful prayers recognizing the supreme lord to
and also the enjoyer of all sacrifices, Yajneesha, this is very important.
All Yajnas are meant for satisfying the Supreme Lord and he is the master of all
Yajnas, all sacrifices. He is a recipient of all the offerings in the sacrifice.
And by doing such sacrifices, anyone who performs sacrifice is benefited
personally by the Supreme Lord. I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
